fields.description:
One of the cool (read: eye candy) things about bitbucket.org (other than the Hg support ;)) is that it has a timeline showing branches and where they were branched from, and showing merges between different branches.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100108-dsgsp5xr5jxjxb9pgrtekwf8sg.jpg|width=800px!

Would probably be better if it was a horizontal line chart though. 

Would be cool if we could do something similar in FE. Each of the points could have a hover showing who did the merge, the commit message, with a link to the changesets.
fields.summary: Visual Repository timeline, showing branches / merges

fields.description: !http://img.skitch.com/20100107-k6q61syas3j1f3759wm7eu6fpy.jpg!
fields.summary: A favourited repository gets an active link in the favourites page even when the repo is closed

fields.description:
We would like the functionality to filter (exclude & include) the indexing by user accounts, similar to how the paths are handled.

We have system accounts which auto commit to Subversion certain build results and old user accounts we would like to filter out.

Thanks

Adam
fields.summary: CLONE -Filter Indexing by User Account

fields.description:
If you have a number of repositories and you have excluded a particular file extension in the repository defaults, you can't override that on a per repo basis. 

Consider you have excluded *.csv in the repository defaults, but later on you have a new repo where you want to see csv files. The only option is to move the exclude to all the other repos and remove it from the defaults. 

A checkbox "Ignore Repository Defaults" would avoid this situation.
fields.summary: Option to "Ignore Repository Defaults"
Watches don't work when using the left hand navigation.

fields.description:
1) Enter repository information using subversion
2) enter incorrect information (e.g. password)
3) click test - no change on page (one instance of subversion spawned and CPU load increases)
4) try Re-index Crucible Data, Re-index Linecount Data, Scan Now, etc. and watch your system load soar.
5) Let run for days and the system load will increase.

The default Throttle connections-per-sec: (not throttled)
Svn Operation Timeout: (default)

This almost scaled to 4 Xeon E5410 2.33GHz CPU cores (out of 8) for just FishEye. This also occurred on the previous version.


strace -p XXX-process-id-of-subversion-spawned-by-fisheye-XXX
...

read(0, "( CRAM-MD5 ( ) ) "..., 4096)   = 17

fields.description:
The httponly is a hack to add it into the cookies, so that it cannot be modified by javascript. Currently, the java servlet api doesn't have an API to add it, so it was hacked in.

Sample http headers:
{noformat}
http://localhost:8060/browse

GET /browse HTTP/1.1
Host: localhost:8060
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.1.6) Gecko/20091201 Firefox/3.5.6 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)
Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8
Accept-Language: en-us,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip,deflate
Accept-Charset: ISO-8859-1,utf-8;q=0.7,*;q=0.7
Keep-Alive: 300
Connection: keep-alive
Cookie: crucibleprefs1="D%3D1262590562484%3Basv%3Dcru"; remember=user:6:297d6fed9c62978c0637dc380f42283b

HTTP/1.x 200 OK
Expires: Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT
Set-Cookie: remember=user:6:0c7f92f5d29cbe9b904566ad6d8dab49;httpOnly;Path=/;Expires=Tue, 04-Jan-11 07:58:49 GMT
Set-Cookie: crucibleprefs1="D%3D1262591929250%3Basv%3Dcru";Path=/;Expires=Tue, 04-Jan-11 07:58:49 GMT
Set-Cookie: FESESSIONID=gh46z0ig5rn0;Path=/
Cache-Control: private
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Length: 4723
Server: Jetty(6.1.16)
{noformat}

But when the username contains an email address, the Cookie provided to the server has the 'HttpOnly' flag appended to it, e.g.:
{noformat}
Cookie: crucibleprefs1="D%3D1266202057531"; FESESSIONID=muwzms32528c; remember="charles.albrecht%40pearson.com:19:aff45f98c5e18f568728451acf55419a;httpOnly"; crucibleprefs1="D%3D1235952715010"
{noformat}

As a work-around, you can either change tour usernames to not include '@' symbols, or increase your session timeout as described here: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCKB/Increasing+the+session+timeout
fields.summary: 'remember' cookies for users with characters needing to be url escaped (e.g. '@' or ' ') in their username do not work

fields.description:
The version of svnkit we bundle with fisheye doesn't have SASL support:

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ jar tf svnkit-1.3.0.5847.jar | grep Sasl
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit]$ 
{noformat}

If I download it from the website it does (this is a newer version, but apparently older ones have it too):

{noformat}
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ jar tf svnkit.jar | grep Sasl
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator$SVNCallbackHandler.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SVNSaslAuthenticator.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslInputStream.class
org/tmatesoft/svn/core/internal/io/svn/sasl/SaslOutputStream.class
[amyers@erdinger:svnkit-1.3.2.6267]$ 
{noformat}

Is there any technical reason we don't bundle the support for SASL authentication?
fields.summary: SASL support with bundled svnkit

Additionally, an error occured trying to render this page.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Context not available, filter already exited
{panel}

fields.summary: Regression: Deleted folders no longer show as greyed out:

fields.description:
In 2.0 when using an external avatar service (e.g. gravatar), a charlietar (internal avatar) url was appended to the external avatar url so that a charlietar was displayed when an external one wasn't available. With the introduction of John Doe avatars this feature has been lost. Whilst I recognize how much some people hated the charlietar I think the old behaviour should be the default, possibly with an option to use the blank ones.

Ideally the admin screen would let the use select the fallback avatar from internal, none, or the popuplar ones gravatar supports. See attached.
fields.summary: Fall back to internal avatars

fields.description:
The atl.general page decorator should render FE/CRUs default header and footer. It looks like it was left behind in the ui overhall. 

Here is what you currently see:

!http://img.skitch.com/20091218-gkr2uhgah67yjsa1h5kwwt68kp.jpg!
fields.summary: The Page decorator atl.general does not work.

fields.description:
We have a skeleton [ClearCaseLogicalPathMatcher |https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/atlassian/fisheye/clearcase/ClearCaseLogicalPathMatcher.java?r=48426] that just throws exceptions.

It needs to be implemented.
fields.summary: Implement logical path matcher for ClearCase

fields.description:
Our developers use private Sandboxes to create codelines for isolating work from primary development lines. Five or six of these sandbox codelines might be created in an average week, higher when developers roll onto new projects. Though these Sandboxes are in a different Perforce Depot, they are indexed as part of the same Fisheye Repository. When an individual developer branches 8k-17k files, Fisheye spends an inordinately long time (12-18 hours) indexing the change - apparently going through the laborious process of {{p4 print}} (see FE-227) on every file when it is known to be identical to the file it was branched from.

Perforce itself utilizes lazy copying so that only an rcs representation of the source file is retained and a reference to that versioned file is utilized. I would prefer to see Fisheye utilize a similar approach when perforce identifies that the revision in the change was created via a "branch" operation (or "move/add"), copying internal metadata from the internal metadata for the source revision (if part of the same fisheye repository) rather than recreating that data based on a {{p4 print}} of the changed revision in question.
fields.summary: Leverage perforce revision "branch" information to implement lazy indexing

fields.description:
Sometimes FishEye stops scanning because of an error with certain revisions in the repo. 

A customer would like it if Fisheye marked the changeset as failed and just continued scanning. In the customers example {{p4 describe}} failed because of a missing description.
fields.summary: Option to continue scanning repos in the event of failure, rather than giving up.

fields.description:
The {{outerHight}} reported by jQuery in IE7 and IE8 differs from the layout numbers when you inspect the line {{<li>}} using the developer tools.

This is causing the drawn segment markers to misalign.
fields.summary: Side by side diff segment markers don't align in IE

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# svnadmin create test_repo
# svn mkdir --parents file:///Users/amyers/test_repo/trunk/src/main/java/com/atlassian --username CamelCase -m ""
# Create a user in fisheye with the username CamelCase
# Add the repo to fisheye and let it scan
# Go to the people tab and the commit sparkline will show the latest activity, but no sparkline \\ !activity.jpg!
# rename the user CamelCase to camelcase (i.e. make it lowercase)
# The commit sparkline will work as expected
fields.summary: Commit Sparkline shows as empty even if there are commits with mixed case usernames

fields.description:
The fisheye activity screen randomly forgets my preference.  I have not been able to pinpoint the exact cause yet (sometimes it remembers and sometimes it doesn't).  I like to keep the commits-only view and it keeps switching back to "All Activity"

This is on atlaseye.
fields.summary: Activity Stream forgets my tab preference

fields.description: Currently, the View Storage Location is a mandatory field for ClearCase repositories.  It should instead be made optional, and the code which attempts to create views for VOBs being indexed should handle the View Storage Location not being specified by not passing a '-vws' argument to the 'cleartool mkview' command.
fields.summary: Make View Storage Location an optional field

fields.description:
When I upgraded from our 1.6.7 dev build (created for us by Partha) to 2.1.2 I get the following error and then FishEye dies.

{noformat}
2009-12-09 15:57:55,162 ERROR [main] fisheye.app Run-mainImpl - Could not start quartz schedule: Application Context not initialised.
java.lang.RuntimeException: Application Context not initialised.
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.SpringContext.getApplicationContext(SpringContext.java:32)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.config.SpringContext.getComponent(SpringContext.java:63)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.mainImpl(Run.java:271)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.ctl.Run.main(Run.java:69)

        at com.cenqua.fisheye.FishEyeCtl.main(FishEyeCtl.java:39)
{noformat}

This is running on a test server, we have planned to upgrade the production server this Saturday (12-12-2009).

fields.description: system.header.item webitems produce an odd looking trailing '|'. Presumably they're meant to be seperators between each tab but having one following the final tab looks wrong.
fields.summary: system.header.item webitems have strange trailing '|' character

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

# Set up a git repository. 
# mkdir test
# date > test/now.txt
# git add . 
# git commit

Now set up the repo in fisheye and exclude /test/. When fisheye tries to scan this it will throw an illegal state exception: 

{noformat}ERROR - Problem processing revisions from repo GitTest due to class java.lang.IllegalStateException - 
Unable to load changeset for ddb9ed0395a2e0d00c94845f1a5a746141193c03
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to load changeset for ddb9ed0395a2e0d00c94845f1a5a746141193c03
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitCache.getChangeSet(GitCache.java:114)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScanner$5.perform(GitScanner.java:356)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.git.GitScanner$5.perform(GitScanner.java:350){noformat} 

It can't find the changeset because we have excluded the files from fisheye.
fields.summary: Illegal state exception when excluding files from a git repo

fields.description:
FishEye only has pages that represent physical paths.  It would be very useful to also have a hierarchy of pages that represent logical paths.

It would be a great destination when clicking on search results, as it may not be clear which physical branch of a particular hit the user is interested in.

It would also be a natural location for the branch graph and any other data related to a logical (rather than physical) path and could serve as a point of navigation between branches of a single logical path.
fields.summary: Pages that represent logical paths

fields.description:
During the initial slurp of a repository, a yellow warning header appears on relevant pages to explain that the page may be incomplete.

If FishEye is restarted during an initial slurp, this warning no longer appears, despite the fact that there may be many hours (or even days) of indexing remaining.
fields.summary: Warning that initial slurp is in progress does not appear after FishEye is restarted during initial slurp
Display repository URL when viewing source

fields.description:
Error is thrown when adding user mapping. This happen if there is no fisheye user created in the instance.
{noformat}
2009-12-04 18:23:55,421 ERROR [btpool0-3] org.mortbay.log org.mortbay.log.Slf4jLog-warn - /admin/addUserMapping.do
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot have null or empty arguments for functions in CommitterUserMappingManager
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.model.Managers.CommitterUserMappingManager.assertArguments(CommitterUserMappingManager.java:187)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.model.Managers.CommitterUserMappingManager.addMapping(CommitterUserMappingManager.java:100)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.admin.actions.user.AddUserMappingAction.execute(AddUserMappingAction.java:73)

	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invokeAction(DefaultActionInvocation.java:358)

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to {{Admin > User Mapping}} and add mapping for repository
# Assumming there is no user created in Fisheye instance (see [mapping|^mapping.png])
# Adding the mapping leads to the above error

Error shows from the UI;
!error.png!
fields.summary: Error is thrown when adding user mapping

fields.description:
The error is thrown while editing the author mapping:
{noformat}
2009-12-04 18:27:27,250 ERROR [btpool0-5] org.mortbay.log org.mortbay.log.Slf4jLog-warn - /profile/editAuthorMapping.do
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: committerName and repositoryName cannot be null: committerName=null,repositoryName=SVN-12

fields.description:
Mapped committers to the A.D. Ministrator user and they are showing up in the activity stream

!http://img.skitch.com/20091204-b1c3wjukctw29cm4iw7n6gfx3y.jpg!

Viewing the people tab doesn't show A.D. Ministrator

!http://img.skitch.com/20091204-n41cbcxyursynbtmsygsh262sq.jpg!
fields.summary: Mapped Commiters not showing up on People tab when viewing a repository

fields.description:
eg at [http://fisheye1.atlassian.com/changelog/firebird/?cs=%3Aasfernandes%3A20091021010105]
(note missing branch in csid)
!http://madbean.com/pub/skitch/2009/bug-20091204-111106.jpg!
fields.summary: NPE when displaying a partial CSID match on changeset page: javax.el.ELException: Problems calling function 'cru:hiddenClasses'

fields.description:
When looking at a diff in a crucible review there are many options available to the user to improve using the diff. These include setting the number of lines of context, whitespace etc. When looking at a changelist these options do not exist. 

In particular being able to set the number of lines of context is particularly important to allow us to scan through these diffs. The current solution is to create a review to be able to efficiently scan a changelist. This is inefficient for us as not all changelists need to be reviewed under our current policies.

It would be very appreciated if you could move towards a more unified set of options for looking at a file diff in both Crucible and Fisheye.
fields.summary: Request for consistent diff options between crucible file view and fisheye file view

fields.description:
Viewing very large changesets can hang the browser temporarily causing firefox to prompt you to kill JS for the page:

!js.jpg!

The JS hangs the entire browser, so we should handle it a bit smarter and perhaps split up the page loading better. Grab the first 50 or so changes, then if there are more, load them in chunks as you scroll down the page.
fields.summary: Large changesets can hang the browser temporarily

fields.description:
At present when you view a file revision in fisheye, it will show you what branches and tags were created from this revision. 

!info.jpg!

What it doesn't show you is where the files were branched from. If you look at the output of svn log it tells you:

{noformat}------------------------------------------------------------------------
r3 | amyers | 2009-11-30 14:51:44 +1100 (Mon, 30 Nov 2009) | 2 lines
Changed paths:
   A /branches/1.0 (from /trunk:2)

Creating branch 1.0
{noformat}

So it would be good in fisheye could detect that and show that branch 1.0 came from trunk @ revision 2 and show something like a "Branched From" section with the "Branch Points for".
fields.summary: Show where branches / tags etc were copied from in subversion

fields.description:
I'm trying to set up fisheye to use a clearcase repository, and have run into issues.  These issues are being discussed on the forum here:   http://forums.atlassian.com/post!reply.jspa?messageID=257324941

But I also wanted to raise an issue to track the problem I'm now see:

I would like to remove the bad repository so I can try to start over, but it got stuck in "Stopping" and cannot be removed.  Ross Rowe suggested via forum that I try manually removing the <repository> tags from config.xml and restart fisheye.  After doing this, I cannot connect to fisheye admin at all, and can no longer browse the previously working CVS repository.

Fisheye logs attached - thanks for investigating!
fields.summary: Can't remove faulty clearcase repository

fields.description:
We explicitly deny it in {{com.atlassian.fisheye.stars.StarManager}}

For consistencies sake we should probably allow you to rename them.
fields.summary: Can't rename favourites on Users, Committers and Directories

fields.description:
Currently after updating the label, the list of favourites won't show the new value until you refresh the page. 

After successfully updating the label, we should change the list to reflect the new value without having to force the user to refresh the page.
fields.summary: When you update the label of a favourite when viewing the favourites tab on the dashboard we should update the item in the list.

fields.description:
The default JIRA mappings allows the mapping of  *ALL* JIRA projects to some or all FE repos & CRU projects. It also populates the anon activity stream with all JIRA activity from that overwhelming any review or commit activity. 

It would be good to be able to select a subset of JIRA projects as default mappings rather than simply all. 

Note that if you explicitly map all your JIRA projects to FE repos and Cru projects and don't use default mappings this isn't an issue. It also only causes problems on the anon dashboard, so an alternative solution would be to only show explicitly mapped JIRA activity on the anon dashboard.
fields.summary: Select explicit JIRA projects in Default JIRA mappings

fields.description: Currently, separate cleartool invocations are being issued for every interaction with ClearCase.  We've found that by running clearcase in interactive mode and issuing all subsequent commands with the running process, the time taken to perform the ClearCase operations is reduced by 50-100 milliseconds
fields.summary: Invoke cleartool in interactive mode rather than creating new instances for each invocation

fields.description: Currently, the ClearCase support attempts to index the entire history of a VOB.  A useful enhancement would be to allow users to specify the start date, so that FishEye would only index files that were created on or after the start date
fields.summary: Allow users to specify a start date for repository indexing
Improve git rename detection
Allow git executable location to be configured

fields.description:
In order to get a snapshot of what changed between releases, we use an EyeQL search.  See this one: https://www.limewire.org/fisheye/search/limecvs/?ql=select%20revisions%0D%0Awhere%20between%20tags%20%28prod-5-4-1-java16%2C%20prod-5-4-2-java16%5D%0D%0Agroup%20by%20changeset%0D%0A .  It is "select revisions where between tags (prod-5-4-1-java16, prod-5-4-2-java16] group by changeset".  In Fisheye 1, this produced a search results page where each changeset was shown & a description of the changeset was shown.  In Fisheye 2, this produces a table with files and a link to the changesets.

The FE2 version lost all the functionality of "group by changeset".  If I want to group by changeset, I *don't* want each individual file listed, and I *do* want to see the changeset commit message.  With FE2, in order to get an idea of what happened I need to click on each changeset link and read each message, and each link is duplicated for every file that changed in the changeset.

Major, major loss of functionality.
fields.summary: Search doesn't show changeset description anymore

fields.description: Currently, the VOB/UCM Project information is retrieved from ClearCase everytime the ClearCase Admin UI is opened (either by editing a repository or adding a new repository).  As this information  rarely changes, it should be cached for the duration of the users session.
fields.summary: Cache the VOB/Project info that is used to populate the ClearCase Admin UI

fields.description: Allow users to select multiple VOBs for inclusion (either by using a multi-select list or including a + option next to the drop down list
fields.summary: Allow users to select multiple VOBs to include

fields.description: On the ClearCase Admin screen, add another drop down above the 'VOB to Include' drop down that allowed you to select a pvob. then the vob selection list would be updated with the vobs in that pvob
fields.summary: Allow users to select VOBs based on selected PVOBs

fields.description: An exception is generated when the Admin UI is opened (the error indicates that cleartool can't be found, and this occurs in environments where ClearCase has not been installed).
fields.summary: An cleartool exception is generated when the Admin UI is opened

fields.description:
e.g. on the sandbox

http://sandbox.fisheye.atlassian.com/changelog/rails/?cs=530b8f works, whereas http://sandbox.fisheye.atlassian.com/changelog/rails/?cs=530b8fd (with an extra char) doesn't. It should return a changeset not found page like [this one|http://sandbox.fisheye.atlassian.com/changelog/google-guice/?cs=2131]
fields.summary: Invalid changeset ids produce 500s when they should 404

fields.description: Currently, ClearCase attempts to create a specific view for each VOB/UCM Project being indexed.  If a view already exists for the VOB/UCM Project and is available, FishEye should use this view instead.
fields.summary: Allow FishEye to use existing ClearCase views

fields.description:
Add a plugin point on the users page such that reports specific to that user could be plugged in. 

!http://img.skitch.com/20091124-nfieseqfb6bpd93fec13tmrthu.jpg!
fields.summary: Plugin point to add reports to individual users pages.

fields.description: The 'VOB to Include' field is populated with all non UCM VOBs (ie. no PVOBs).  This should be updated to include PVOBs so that UCM FishEye Repositories can specify the specific PVOB to index.
fields.summary: The 'VOB to Include' field only displays non-PVOBs

fields.description: !create.jpg!
fields.summary: Can't select default charset when creating a CVS repository

fields.description:
It is possible for Fisheye to get confused with the URL and assume that ?r=HEAD is part of the directory name...

To recreate:

# Open a repository in Fisheye.
# Choose a file in the left pane.
# Visit its "Source" tab on the right pane.
# Choose a directory in the left pane (to view its history on the right).
# Choose the same directory again in the left pane...

The right pane should now be empty with the incorrect title shown.
fields.summary: Directories include ?r=HEAD

fields.description: If you specify the path for a git repository it gets ignored and won't be saved.
fields.summary: Git repository configuration doesn't save the path

fields.description: Any entered values into the VOB or UCM Inclusion rules are not displayed on the Repository details window (they do appear on the Edit Repository page)
fields.summary: Values entered in the VOB/UCM Inclusion rules are not displayed on the Repository Details page

fields.description:
We are unable to index two of our vobs.  The logs show a NullPointerException as shown below.

I can provide more details if required.

{code}
2009-11-23 12:09:47,283 ERROR [IncrementalPinger1] fisheye.app com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRepositoryEngine-slurpTx - Problem processing revisions from repo XXXX due to class java.lang.NullPointerException - null

fields.description:
after the fisheye server has been improperly shutdown (power failure to server for instance) and fisheye is restarted using the start.sh script, users who navigate to the application are asked to run the setup wizard again. 

Running the wizard scrambles the current setup which requires removing the application folders and database tables and reinstalling. 

there should be some safeguard around improper/unforeseen shutdowns.
fields.summary: Fisheye runs setup wizard on recovery from improper shutdown

fields.description:
FishEye currently does not index VOBs marked as 'private'.  Since the 'private' marker only affects whether VOBs are automatically mounted or not, VOBs marked 'private' should be included in the indexing logic.

See http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/cchelp/v7r0m1/index.jsp?topic=/com.ibm.rational.clearcase.cc_admin.doc/topics/c_vobadm_public_private.htm for more information
fields.summary: Allow FishEye to index private ClearCase VOBs

fields.description: Please vote and comment here for Oracle database support.
fields.summary: Support for Oracle database

fields.description: Currently, the Base ClearCase logic performs a lshistory on the VOB to retrieve the list of checkins to index.  This logic should be updated to make use of the '-since' flag, so that on subsequent indexes, the lshistory commands only retrieves checkins after the last index date.
fields.summary: Improve performance of Base ClearCase indexing

fields.description: Users tab does not seem to list any relevant users.
fields.summary: Users tab doesn't show any users that are actually committing to the current directory

fields.description: Adding an explanation of this and telling people to use "Scan now" would be better than nothing, but it would be good if the scan was kicked off automatically.
fields.summary: "Re-index Repository" relies on the updater to kick off the reindex, which is bad if the indexer is turned off or set to a long interval

fields.description: html is being escaped, eg javadoc correction Hit highlighting will also interact badly with wiki markup (I haven't got data handy to test that on, but I'm sure it won't be pretty)
fields.summary: Html for hit highlighting in quicksearch comment results is being escaped

fields.description:
Fails with the following error:

{noformat}Caused by: java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.tigris.subversion.javahl.ChangePath.getNodeKind()I
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.examinePaths(DiffProcessor.java:459)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffProcessor.processMessage(DiffProcessor.java:278)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.process(DiffFetcher.java:64)
        at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.diff.DiffFetcher.run(DiffFetcher.java:45)
{noformat}

The workaround is to use the bundled svnkit client. Upgrading to SVN 1.6 may also fix the problem.
fields.summary: Native client doesn't work with Fisheye 2.1.x and SVN 1.5
Update changeset-mail-*.ftl files

fields.description: * http://skitch.com/misdreavous/n84bi/home-hao-ye-extranet
fields.summary: The FishEye Charts gadget view is cutoff after denying authorization

fields.description: In configuration, if the 'Repository' field is blank or invalid, saving the gadget silently fails.
fields.summary: Fisheye Charts gadget silently fails trying to save configuration

fields.description: Emails watches of a git repo in FishEye are a bit useless. See screenshot.
fields.summary: Git emails are a bit of fail

fields.description:
The clearcase documentation is out of date: 

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/ClearCase

Some new fields have been added and we should describe those. 

!cc.jpg!
fields.summary: ClearCase documentation needs to be updated

fields.description:
The list of vobs is shown in the includes/excludes section of the repository config, but when the repo scans it throws this error: 

{noformat}com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: No vobsToReturn were found
at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseBaseContext.getVobs(ClearCaseBaseContext.java:111)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.processVobs(ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.java:545)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.processRevisions(ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.java:523)
at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.doSlurp(ClearCaseRepositoryScanner.java:475)
{noformat}
fields.summary: No vobsToReturn were found error scanning ClearCase even though the Vobs were shown in the UI when configuring the repo

fields.description:
*Steps*
1. Go to the login page.
2. The page will focus the username; enter your username.
3. Press tab to focus the password; enter your password
4. Press enter (without tabbing to the _Log in_ button).

*Expected*
- The login form is submitted.

*Actual*
- The form doesn't submit and the page just sits there.

Clicking the _Log in_ button or tabbing to it and pressing enter does submit the form.
fields.summary: Enter doesn't submit login form in IE8

fields.description:
In fisheye 1.6.6 you could simply enter a number such as 10 for the P4 Operation Timeout. 

Fisheye 2.1 forces you to specify the time units such as {{10 minutes}}. 

The problem is if you upgrade from 1.6.x you won't be able to edit the value through the web interface and an error is logged:

{noformat}java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: commandTimeout '10' is not valid
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.admin.data.P4RepositoryData.setCommandTimeout(P4RepositoryData.java:142)
        at com.atlassian.fisheye.spi.admin.impl.AdminSpiUtil.copyP4FieldsToRepData(AdminSpiUtil.java:257){noformat}

We should default the timeout to use minutes if no unit is specified. 

The fix is to edit your {{FISHEYE_INST/config.xml}} and change the {{commandTimeout}} attribute to specify the time units on the {{<perforce>}} element

{code:xml}<perforce casesensitive="true" path="//depot/" initial-import="false" 
   port="1666" server="erdinger" skip-labels="false" 
   unicode="false" command-timeout="10 minutes">{code}
fields.summary: P4 Operation Timeout settings changed from 1.6.x to 2.x

fields.description:
At the moment when you load the dashboard and it goes off to do the cross repository search it will timeout at 10s and give you the option to continue loading with a greater timeout. 

Can this timeout be made configurable via the UI or even as a user preference as some customers still view 10s as too long (while others may want more results back, thus wishing to increase the timeout).
fields.summary: Allow the timeout for dashboard to be configurable
Do not creat tags when files are copied into a tag area from outside the repository scope

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
1. Create a new Subversion repository, selecting 'Yes' for _Use In-built Symbolic Rules_.

*Expected*
- When viewing the repository settings, it should say "Use In-built Symbolic Rules: true"

*Actual*
- It says "Use In-built Symbolic Rules: false"

Editing the repository and setting this value to 'Yes' has the same result, i.e., it remains 'false'.

This works in the 2.0 branch, so is a regression in 2.1.
fields.summary: Can't set the use built-in symbolic rules for Subversion repositories
Use of toggle() to open Activity Stream items not supported in IE8
SVN properties entry in Activity Stream needs loving

fields.description:
Currently all charts display data that is calculated and made into pretty charts.
There is no way to export this data into other raw formats to be included in other metric systems (IE no raw CSV or excel option).

The 'Other' section can also cause a large number of data points to be lost with no way to expose them.
fields.summary: All Chart data to be exportable in CSV or Excel format

fields.description:
The small icons next the revisions on activity streams are incorrect - see screenshot.

In my brief investigation, it seems this is two bugs. 

# p4 changes are not setting the correct style for a modified revision. So that is one issue. 
# the default icon is wrong (it is a changeset icon) and not aligned
fields.summary: revision icons not inline on p4 repo activity streams

fields.description: FF3.5, S4 - diff navigation is broken. Clicking on a diff navigation link does nothing.
fields.summary: File History Diff navigation broken in 2.1
Close LDAP NamingEnumerations

fields.description: !IE7.jpg!
fields.summary: Column headers don't display correctly in IE7 on Repositories tab

fields.description: The code which is obtaining the name to use when creating a view under Base ClearCase for the repository indexing logic is splitting the VOB name on the '/' character.  This code needs to be updated to split on the '\' character in order to cater for Base ClearCase environments running on Windows.
fields.summary: Base ClearCase code generates incorrect view name on Windows

fields.description:
I was browsing with Fisheye in my SVN repository and got an error message "Index out of bounds exception".

No idea what caused it.

(p.s. why is the Affects Version/s list in JIRA all weird + out of order?)
fields.summary: out of bounds error?

fields.description:
If the ClearCase content retrieval logic encounters an error when retrieving file content for a version (which might occur if the logged in user does not have read access to the version), an exception is thrown which causes the retrieval of content to cease.  The code should be updated such that the exception is logged, but the processing of the content retrieval is allowed to continue.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1175 for more details
fields.summary: Attempt to continue when errors occur in the content retrieval logic

fields.description: Currently when viewing a directory in fisheye it shows you the files inside, but no properties of the directory. Some customers would also like to see the information on directories.
fields.summary: Show SVN properties for directories

fields.description:
In instances with a huge number of repositories (Test case: 842, but this bug affects anyone over 50) the Blue Box repository drop down will expand the scroll until all the repositories are listed.   This causes issues as clicking off screen or the browser scroll bar sometimes closes the repository list.

Would this work better as a multi-columned select?  Perhaps offer a Text box which narrows down the field as you type.
fields.summary: Repository List Drop down - Repository list 'goes on forever' and disapears if mis-clicked

fields.description: Enhance FishEye notification emails to include information from JIRA. As what I'm sure is common practice our Perforce submissions include a relating JIRA ID. It would be very useful to see information such as the JIRA Issues Summary in the Fisheye email notification. Not sure if this would be done in FishEye or the FishEye-JIRA plugin.
fields.summary: Display JIRA issues in FishEye email

fields.description:
When configuring perforce to access a p4 repository to a specific path such as //depot, perforce will scan the entire repository for changes. It appears to be filtering out those changes with the supplied include and exclude directives on the server.

We have very large repositories with heavy use and Fisheye/Crucible are impacting their performance by performing these large scans. We would like to limit their p4 scans to a specific client spec.

Can you provide guidance on how to do this or whether it is possible?
fields.summary: Is there a way to have fisheye/crucible use a p4 clientspec when performing its operations?
Right edge of Issues button missing in IE8

fields.description: The built-in 'remember me' functionality (using the 'remember' cookie) is broken when SSO is enabled.  The cookie is still created & the date is still a year in the future... but Fisheye/Crucible appears to ignore it.  If I disable SSO, the functionality starts working again.  If I re-enable SSO, it breaks and I need to re-login every time I start a new session.
fields.summary: 'remember me' functionality broken when SSO is turned on

fields.description: The duplication of user info between data0.bin and the sql user table is painful (also see: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2278). We'd be better off to completely move all user info into the SQL db.
fields.summary: Move all user info from data0.bin into SQL db

fields.description:
When the source tab is selected, there is a small menu which lets me select the current working repository. However, this menu automatically closes after 1-3 seconds (depending on browser and system load; regardless of mouse movement), thus forcing me to select _really_ quick.

Please leave this window open until a repository is selected or the action is cancelled by the user.
fields.summary: Quicklaunch of repositories closes before repository selection.

fields.description:
The quicklaunch menu for my favourites in the top level navigation bar is to narrow, thus truncating the captions of the favourites.

This is especially bad if somebody (like myself) uses prefixes for organization - a look at the status bar is necessary to actually know, what a favourite points to.

Please make the width of the quicklaunch menu dynamic, so it adjusts to the widest entry.
fields.summary: Quicklaunch of favourites to narrow.
